channel.title: Port forwarding help
channel.description:
hello i am trying to make a no-ip server, i got no-ip duc and ive created a no-ip. - when i try to portforward using ikiliki's guide, it says to go to applications and games - when i log into my router i see applications - but not games.
when i click in applications it says
- Quick Setup on Current Computer - This allows you to map a special application to run between the Internet and a specific connected device.
- Port Mapping Setup - This allows you to set up applications on the computer that you are currently using.
- DMZ (Demilitarized Zone) - This allows you to bypass the firewall function of this Home Networking modem, completely exposing a single computer or connected device to the Internet.
* so what do i do? how do i portforward. please reply and help.

item.title: Port forwarding help
item.dc:creator: @kyled123 kyled123
item.description:
@kyled123 wrote:

no i doubt it if you can help anyone, and plus i cant post a picture if you can read, for the second time…

Read full topic

item.title: Port forwarding help
item.dc:creator: @kyled123 kyled123
item.description:
@kyled123 wrote:

[quote=“njr99, post:2, topic:175982”]easy way
go to your firewall settings,click add port…
name:rsps
port:(your port ex.43594)

this should always work :P[/quote] it dont work.

Read full topic

item.title: Port forwarding help
item.dc:creator: @njr99 njr99
item.description:
@njr99 wrote:

easy way
go to your firewall settings,click add port…
name:rsps
port:(your port ex.43594)

this should always work

Read full topic

hello i am trying to make a no-ip server, i got no-ip duc and ive created a no-ip. - when i try to portforward using ikiliki’s guide, it says to go to applications and games - when i log into my router i see applications - but not games.

when i click in applications it says

  • Quick Setup on Current Computer - This allows you to map a special application to run between the Internet and a specific connected device.

  • Port Mapping Setup - This allows you to set up applications on the computer that you are currently using.

  • DMZ (Demilitarized Zone) - This allows you to bypass the firewall function of this Home Networking modem, completely exposing a single computer or connected device to the Internet.
